SENT.plain: Hospital admissions for acute stroke were monitored over a twelve month period
Only patients age 20 and over were studied
Out of a population at risk of 114931 there were 116 cases, giving an overall incidence of 1.01 admissions per 1000 population per year over age 20
Cerebral hemorrhages were present in 32.8%, large artery thromboses in 31.9%, cerebral embolism in 13.8% and lacunar infarctions in 20.7% of cases
Atrial fibrillation was the presumed cause of cerebral embolism in 6.9% of patients
Hypertension was present in 69.8% of patients
Further studies are needed to establish the characteristics of stroke in the Third World
